page.title: 09BROMYARD FOLK FESTIVAL
page.content: The first annual{Folk Festival started in{1968,}as a{Ceilidh}in a shed. The Festival became popular with campers. The attendance figures are usually about{2000.}It became so popular it was thought it would have to end due to lack of space. A local farmer offered the use of his field, called{Broad Bridge. The{Folk music}and{Morris Dancing dates back further than 1968. Every year Morris and Folk dancers come from all over Britain, during the first week in{September.}Bromyard is a very important venue for national Folk and Morris dancers. The local Morris side,{Faithful {City,}helps to organise and present this festival. Exhibition dancing is performed in the local hospital and Old People's Home.
